info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:30AM CDT until May 1 at 5:24AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Little River near Tecumseh affecting Seminole and Pottawatomie Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little River near Tecumseh.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Significant flooding to depths of 6 feet damages croplands... pastures... and rural roads along the river downstream of the U.S. Highway 177 bridge crossing... with lesser damage occurring upstream of U.S. Highway 177. The area affected is entirely rural... and downstream of Lake Thunderbird... from near Macomb in Pottawatomie County to near Bowlegs in western Seminole County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The Little River is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
